bibl.title: James Robinson v. Territory of Washington. Affidavit
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Eastern Regional Branch
msIdentifier.collection: Walla Walla County Government; Clerk, Territorial Court Civil/Criminal Case Files, 1860-1889

div1.p: Territory of Washington County of Walla Walla }s.s.

George H. Porter, Being duly sworn upon his oath says that affiant verily believes the crime of Grand Larceny has been committed at said County on or about the 12th day of June 1862. That some Person or persons did felouiouslu steal, take, drive, and carry away out of the possion of one Peter Riffs four horses & one mule of the value of $450.00/100. The property of the said Riffs, and convert the saves to their his own use. Contrary to the statute in such cases made and provided and affiant charges one James Robinson of having committed said crime
Wherefore affiant charges prays that the said James Robinson Be arrested and dealt with according to law.
Subscribed and sworn to before me June the 18th 1862
div1.ab: W.P. Horton Justice of the Peace.
